H0.text: Warm and dry is what a stationary air mass over the Gulf of Mexico would typically be.

H1.text: Warm and humid is the typical state of a stationary air mass over the Gulf of Mexico.

H2.text: Cool and dry air is typical of a stationary air mass over the Gulf of Mexico.

H3.text: Cool and humid is what a stationary air mass over the Gulf of Mexico would typically be.

A4.text: Maritime tropical air masses that affect the United States originate in the Caribbean Sea, southern Gulf of Mexico, and tropical Atlantic east of Florida through the Bahamas.

A5.text: Maritime and monsoon air masses are moist.
